item.title: Recipe: Roasted broccoli salad with rice and feta
item.description: Roasted broccoli salad with rice and feta For the rice: prepare 1.5 cups rice according to your taste. Do this first. For the broccoli: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Cut a few heads of broccoli into bite sized florets. Mix in a bowl with olive oil, then place on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle sea salt on top. Roast 12-15 minutes until the broccoli is every so slightly browned on top.

item.title: Lentil, feta, and olive pasta salad
item.description: This delicious lentil, feta, and olive pasta salad is adapted from the cookbook The Best 125 Meatless Pasta Dishes by Mindy Toomay and Susann Geiskopf-Hadler, published by Prima Publishing in 1992. Add 3 cups of water to 1.5 cups of lentils in a saucepan on the stove. Add 2 bay leaves. Bring to a boil and then cook 25-35 minutes until the lentils are done. Rinse under cold water and drain.

item.title: Orzo salad
item.description: repeated from a recipe blog I used to keep, from 2001. A very simple orzo salad. One pound orzo. 1 pint-size tub green olives 1 pint-size tub feta cheese 2 bunches parsley Cook the orzo and rinse with cold water to remove the starch and stop it from cooking. Pit the olives, reserving the juice they came in. (It is key to have good olives for this recipe - we get good ones at Whole Foods or (better) the food coop, "french provencal with herbs".
